alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 11:14PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN LOS ALAMOS, EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL AND NORTHWESTERN SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM MDT... At 1114 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Santa Fe, moving west northwest at 5 to 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, White Rock, Pojoaque, Nambe Lake, Nambe Pueblo, Frijoles, Bandelier National Monument, Tesuque, Pojoaque Pueblo and Cuyamungue. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 274 and 286. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area
